name: AzureAppServiceManage
description: Start, stop, restart, slot swap, slot delete, install site extensions or enable continuous monitoring for an Azure App Service
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription

inputs.name: Action
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Action to be performed on the App Service. You can Start, Stop, Restart, Slot swap, Install site extensions or enable Continuous Monitoring for an Azure App Service

inputs.name: WebAppName
inputs.label: App Service name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or select the name of an existing Azure App Service

inputs.name: SpecifySlot
inputs.label: Specify Slot or App Service Environment
inputs.visibleRule: Action != Swap Slots && Action != Delete Slot && Action != Start Swap With Preview && Action != Complete Swap && Action != Cancel Swap

inputs.name: ResourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or Select the Azure Resource Group that contains the Azure App Service specified above
inputs.visibleRule: Action = Swap Slots || Action = Delete Slot || SpecifySlot = true || Action = Start Swap With Preview || Action = Complete Swap || Action = Cancel Swap

inputs.name: SourceSlot
inputs.label: Source Slot
inputs.helpMarkDown: The swap action directs destination slot's traffic to the source slot
inputs.visibleRule: Action = Swap Slots || Action = Start Swap With Preview  || Action = Complete Swap

inputs.name: SwapWithProduction
inputs.label: Swap with Production
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to swap the traffic of source slot with production. If this option is not selected, then you will have to provide source and target slot names.
inputs.visibleRule: Action = Swap Slots || Action = Start Swap With Preview  || Action = Complete Swap

inputs.name: TargetSlot
inputs.label: Target Slot
inputs.helpMarkDown: The swap action directs destination slot's traffic to the source slot

inputs.name: PreserveVnet
inputs.label: Preserve Vnet
inputs.visibleRule: Action = Swap Slots || Action = Start Swap With Preview || Action = Complete Swap

inputs.name: Slot
inputs.label: Slot
inputs.visibleRule: Action = Delete Slot || Action = Cancel Swap || SpecifySlot = true

inputs.name: ExtensionsList
inputs.label: Install Extensions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Site Extensions run on Microsoft Azure App Service. You can install set of tools as site extension and better manage your Azure App Service. The  App Service will be restarted to make sure latest changes take effect.

inputs.name: OutputVariable
inputs.label: Output variable
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide the variable name for the local installation path for the selected extension.
This field is now deprecated and would be removed. Use LocalPathsForInstalledExtensions variable from Output Variables section in subsequent tasks.

inputs.name: AppInsightsResourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource Group name for Application Insights
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or Select resource group where your application insights resource is available

inputs.name: ApplicationInsightsResourceName
inputs.label: Application Insights resource name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select Application Insights resource where continuous monitoring data will be recorded.
If your application insights resource is not listed here and you want to create a new resource, click on [+New] button. Once the resource is created on Azure Portal, come back here and click on refresh button.

inputs.name: ApplicationInsightsWebTestName
inputs.label: Application Insights web test name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Enter Application Insights Web Test name to be created or updated.
If not provided, the default test name will be used.

outputVariables.name: LocalPathsForInstalledExtensions
outputVariables.description:
The local installation paths for the selected extensions for installation.
Note: In case multiple extensions are selected for installation, the output is a comma separated list of local paths for each of the selected extension in the order they appear in the Install Extensions field.
